description.narrative: Summary: Working through the Baphalali Eswatini Red Cross' Clinic in Silele we are reaching the community through three elements â€“ 1)Â Â Â Â Â Water and Sanitation Rehabilitation of the Water system for the Silele Clinic, Water Committees, Rain water Harvesting and water tank construction, Train BERCS staff in WASH, Hand washing facilities at schools and awareness, Demonstration HHs 2)Â Â Â Â Â Menstrual Hygiene Management Learning workshop with Malawi, Lesotho and Uganda RC, Parental support groups, Teen clubs training, making sanitary pads (potentially), Construct MHM friendly latrine at Silele Clinic, Awareness raising for PSEA 3)Â Â Â Â Â Nutrition Awareness raising on healthy eating and indigenous foods, Key hole gardens demonstration at Silele Clinic, Cooking demonstrations, Community Nutritional status database, Food supplements for mothers and children, Anthropometric kits for the Clinic Location: Silele Clinic and Community in the Shiselweni region Bens: Unknown at the moment Â Donor: Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Di Moody Legacy Fund - Â£350,000 Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â PPL - Â£12,250 Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Finnish Red Cross - â‚¬55,000 PNSs: Finnish Red Cross Budget:Â Â£409,250 for the entire programme Situation - Dec 2019: Assessment phase is ongoing from Oct '19 - March '20. A Wash officer has been hired who will start in Jan 2020. The MHM workshop took place in Nov '19; govt are still unsure around reusable sanitary pads. In depth assessment plans are being established for the next 2/3 months before the final programme design is completed and confirmed Situation â€“ June 2020: Assessment and Planning stage has been delayed due to COVID but close to completion, the Logframe has been finalised, implementation is hopefully going to start asap. Â
To assist with the first 3 months of assessments
